fieldData.title: Right to delay tax payments for entrepreneurs
fieldData.title_nationalLanguage: Versoepeling uitstel van betaling belasting en verlaging boetes
fieldData.descriptionBackgroundInfo: This measure was proposed by the Ministry of Finance and the Dutch Tax Authority. It has been introduced as an emergency measure specifically to combat or cushion the effects of the COVID-19 crisis. The aim is to improve liquidity of the enterprises and self-employed. The ultimate aim is to keep the economy functioning (including the financial flow) until the pandemic is under control.This was part of the package of emergency measures to deal with the coronavirus.
fieldData.descriptionContentOfMeasure: The Dutch Tax Authority is allowing businesses and self-employed people to apply for a delay of their income tax payments for 3 months. It is also possible to request a change in your tax liability in anticipation of lower income (this will still have to be corrected at the end of the year). This applies to: income tax, income-related contribution to the health insurance, corporation tax, sales tax (VAT), insurance tax, gambling tax, landlord levy, environmental taxes, oil, alcohol or tobacco tax, consumption tax . Furthermore, the usual administrative fee for late delivery of tax declarations has been lowered from its usual 4% to 0.01%.
fieldData.descriptionInvolvementOfSocialPartners: Since the outbreak of the Corona crisis, the government has had regular and close consultation with the social partners. Together the national level social partners and the government arrived at the first and second packages of emergency measures, announced March 17th and May 20th respectively.

sources.sources::title: Betalingsproblemen door coronavirus? De Belastingdienst neemt maatregelen om ondernemers (inclusief zzp’ers) te helpen

updates.updates::description: With the emergency measures packet 2.0 (from 20 May 2020), the possibility for enterprises to get a delay for their tax payment was extended till 1 October 2020. On the first request, delay of tax payment will still be for a period of three months. Other tax payment delays have also received the possibility of extension and requests for this can be made by entrepreneurs until mid-June.
